channel.title: Open Issues (ACTEK Support)
channel.description: Unresolved Issues that are assigned to me.

item.title: [ACOM-1989] Change Member Number on Stmts to HICN Number
item.description:
Change Member number on statement to HICN Number
Layout is in subversion:
svn://svn.acteksoft.com:48000/Customers/Arcadian Health Plan/Project/Imp 17 - Statement Excel prototype

The change is highlighted in Red!. We will also have to make this change to the Excel stmts.
item.environment:
region: http://actek-vmdev5:8080/ACom3Arcadian/FormActionServlet
wbutler/actek
DB = Actek-SQL - Name: ACom3ArcadianStaging
item.summary: Change Member Number on Stmts to HICN Number

item.title: [ACOM-1987] OutFileDetail screen - View/Download of log files not handling compressed files correctly.
item.description: When selecting View or Download links from the OutFile detail form for a log file, the application prompts to download/view as a plain text file even though the content is compressed. This should use the zip MIME type so that the appropriate file type and application will be used to open/view the file.
item.summary: OutFileDetail screen - View/Download of log files not handling compressed files correctly.

comments.comment: Note that it appears that the information is correct on the OutFile. I.e. the Compressed field is "Y" and the ContentType is "TXT". However, the screen is apparently not considering the Compressed field value. If the Compressed field is "Y", it should automatically use the ZIP mime type. Otherwise, it should use the ContentType to resolve the mime type.

From: Dean Patterson
Sent: Sunday, November 16, 2008 1:18 PM
To: Kevin Turner
Subject: Downloading log files from OutFile screen

Kevin,

When downloading a log file from the OutFile screen, is that file an actual "Text" file or is it a "Zip" file? I downloaded one from Coventry as a "text" file and opened it and it looks like the following:

e¾h€/Ñ?·sè•7öâ«³¼Ž!{y3?fá.¯í‰a“‰ÏµŸ:úùæQ?x–yô'yâ‡?~øYðSçQ?ß<êç›gëD0<ë<Æƒožzýè?ßyªó¨?yâ??yâ‡_<~ê<õú©û‘'~øÁSáÑŸ¾yêõÃ??Ë~ä‰?~ä©Âãzœo?y’'~ø©ðÔóTŸ?©Ÿo?užzý?ïøYöSçQ?òÄ<ñóÁSÏ“ý¼o?õ<Õë‡?~–yäIžøá§â§ÎS¯?ûkß<ò$Oüâá©×OÝ<}óÔóT÷#Oß<ò$Oüâ9~‡?ÏòøS?ïøùæ©ç‰Ÿo?ò´î·øªžç?~Ù?•síGžøYæ©ç©îGžøá‡?~øá‡?<[<õ~Q÷#Oüð#Oüð³àGžøá‡?~>xêyªû‘'~øá§âGž¾yä ~§Â£?}óÔë‡Ÿo?u?õ#OüðÃÏ?O=Ou?õ<ÕyêõkÚOýó©êõS??ðàYæ5=ªwüð³ìGžøYæ‘'yâ‡ŸŠ?yâ‡_<~ä úq>??ü,ðÈ“<ñ‹‡§^?u?òôÍSÏSÝ<ñƒÇñ;~øYx¿?õÃÏ²?<x–Ç?ãÏwžêë­º?yúæñù üð‹ÇO§^?ü|óÔód~ÁÏ²?yÂƒ??ý?<xðàù8?¨ž§úú§ž'<ú??ý¢Â#Oò„?OýÔýÈ??üàÁóÁS?¿¤>¿¨û©óÔë‡Ÿo?užzýðóíGžøYæ‘'yZæ‘'<Ë<õþäýŸðàÁSá1Ÿùæ‘§ï<¹_‚ï<Õû“ñŽ?~øáçƒ§ž§º?yâ‡?ÇcÔÏ‡?yúæ©ç©î§ž'õ#Oxô?~øÅèGž¾ýàÑ/øÅ3Â£?-û‘§o?òÄ??æO??y’'¼xx¼ŸÁwýÔûE=Oê‡Ÿe?yúæq<æ›§ž§º?yâg™§ž'~¾ýÈ??üâñ#Oü,ûÁóÝ/êý‰Ÿo?òÄÏ2O=OüðÃ????òÄÏ2<}óÔëÇû#}×??ýb™Gž¾yÔ<-óÔóT÷SÏS§^?Æ?~øá‡Ÿ?žzžøùö#Oü,ó?Îó0-û×—7ƒ´?Ÿ©ácèOËPýäCRý1{Å~õÍÙ«Ÿ÷NŽ’µ“l?Šòà*de7Ÿ”¡èMÇã´¸]K.†ã<?Ož>OÖ·Zdï´Ç
Added new blob field attribute so that the view/download content handlers can check whether the content is compressed or not.

item.title: [ACOM-1983] Add TranHis field to track source InTranHead
item.description: It would be useful to have a "source" InTranHeadNo field on TranHis to track the InTranHead that possibly resulted in its posting. This should be set to the InTranHeadNo from TranHead at the time the TranHis is generated. Keep in mind that the InTranHeadNo on TranHead changes as "Retro Change" InTranHeads are processed (matching InpKey updates).
item.summary: Add TranHis field to track source InTranHead

item.title: [ACOM-1981] Transaction Posting - setting initpolicypayment=1 if multiple transactions for billmonth
item.description:
Production problem.

When mulitple transactions are sent in during the same billmonth with different premmonths the posting task seems to be marking all of them with initpolicypayment=initial (1). This causes multiple prepays which is incorrect. The first should trigger a prepay with others being subsequent and going towards the earned amount. It should mark the first one as initial and the rest as subsequent.

Dean thinks this was found in Coventry and corrected for them. If so, can this be ported down to the Atlantis version?

For this example 4 of the transactions (premmonth 5,6,7,8) are all in one infile. Premmonth 10 is in a diff infile.

E.g. customer 052487397-01 has multiple transactions for 2008 month 10. They are for prem months 5, 6, 7, 8, 10. Client processed them all the same day. Payout paid the broker and hierarchy a prepay for each transaction. Should have paid the prepay only with the first transaction and all others should have gone towards the earned and comm s/b $0.

You can research using url http://actek-vmdev3/ACom3Atlantis/
login and pswd = kim
db on actek-sql = ACom3Atlantis_Prod_OctEOM
This is the client's test environment.

You can download the backed version of the db from our ftps in the atlantis\backups folder ACom3Atlantis_OctEOM.alz

APlan support #22
item.summary: Transaction Posting - setting initpolicypayment=1 if multiple transactions for billmonth

comments.comment:
SignOff: Dev

Following is part of the logic that was used to determine if transaction represented initial payment:
A cache 'policyIdHS' was created when CompPolicyComputationTask was initialized. A query similar to below was run:

Select CP.PolicyId
From BrokerHistory BH Left Join CustPolicy CP on BH.CustPolicyNo = CP.CustPolicyNo
where BH.PremPeriod < (current period) and CP.PolicyId IS NOT NUL and RecType = 0

The PolicyIds retruned were added to the cache. So the cahce contained policies for which we know payments have been made as of before processing began.
As each transaction was processed the cache was checked, if the policyid for the transaction was present in the cahce, it was considered 'Subsequent'. If it was not present, following query was run:
Select Count(BH.BrokerHistoryNo)
From BrokerHistory BH
Where BH.PremPeriod <= (transaction's premperiod)
AND BH.CustPolicyNo = (transaction's CustPolicyNo)
If the returned count was greater than 0, the transaction was considered 'Subsequent', otherwise 'Initial'.

BrokerHistory is not necessarily created as soon as a transaction is processed. Updates to the database are done in batch. So it is possible when transaction for period 6 was processed, the BrokerHistory for period 5 which was also processed in the current run had not yet been inserted to the database. So the query would retrun 0 and it would be considered initial transaction.

Ported changes made to this task on 6/27/07 by Johnny, that updated the cache as transactions were processed, so when transaction for period 5 is processed, the policy is added to the cahe. When transaction for period 6 is processed in the same run, the logic will find the policy in the cache and consider the transaction 'Subsequent'. The BrokerHistory query will not have to be used in this case.

Also ported the change made by Kevin for Coventry-Dev/411 to fix a bug that could cause NullPointerException.

Modified classes in 4.5.1:
ComPolicyComputationTask
ComputationResources - added paidCustPolicyNoCache
ExistsCache (new)

Did not test. Please test.

Not fixed. All trans in the infile are setting initpolicypayment = 1 when posting instead of only the first one and all others s/b set to 0.
You can use the url below to review. I have posted the Infileid = medprem_diff20080930_182955 only and checked tranhead afterwards.

Testing Notes:
billmonth = 10
e.g. customerid='052487397-01'
Infileid = medprem_diff20080930_182955 = premmonth 5,6,7,8
MedPrem_200810 = premmonth 10
db = ACom3Atlantis on actek-sql
url = http://actek-vmdev3:8085/ACom3Atlantis/
login & pswd = kim

Restored Oct EOM db. Reversed payout and unposted trans for the two infiles listed above.
Set 'before post ' SQL to open status so initpolicypayment is not set on intranhead records.

query before posting:
select * from brokerhistory where customerno=12228203652700000
0 records - correct since no trans have ever been processed for this customer

select tranheadno,runlistnopost,inpkey,premmonth,amount,premiumbilled,
newgroup,initpolicypayment from tranhead where customerno=12228203652700000 and match2='pr'
0 records

Post
Infileid = medprem_diff20080930_182955 = premmonth 5,6,7,8
run queries - 0 records in BH; correct since payout has not been run

select tranheadno,runlistnopost,inpkey,billmonth,premmonth,amount,premiumbilled,
initpolicypayment from tranhead where customerno=12228203652700000 and match2='pr'

tranheadno runlistnopost inpkey billmonth premmonth amount premiumbilled initpolicypayment
12267031535310002 12267030499810004 052487397-01200805PR 10 5 643.20 643.20 1
12267031535470002 12267030499810004 052487397-01200806PR 10 6 643.20 643.20 1
12267031535620002 12267030499810004 052487397-01200807PR 10 7 643.20 643.20 1
12267031535620017 12267030499810004 052487397-01200808PR 10 8 643.20 643.20 1

THIS IS INCORRECT. Ony 2 trans should be 1 and initpolicypayment s/b 0 for all the others.

SignOff: Dev

There was still a bug. CustPolicyNo was being added to the cache only if the BrokerHistory query returned a record. Fixed. This was fixed in changes for Coventry-Dev/796. Ported the change to 4.5.1. Did not test. I had undid posta nd then posted the file 'medprem_diff20080930_182955'. You'll have to undo post again and test. Thanks.

Modified classes in 4.5.1:
CompPolicyComputationTask.java

item.title: [ACOM-1977] Research the ComputationPersistence reversal of TranHead decrement of ComputeCount
item.description: The reversal of TranHead updates in the ComputationPersistence task decrements the ComputeCount field. In cases where Payout reversal fails, the solution is to re-reverse. However, this may cause over decrementing the ComputeCount causing the ComputeCount to be incorrect. Research to determine if we can clear out the RunListNoComp value in addition to decrementing the ComputeCount to prevent the TranHead from being updated again.
item.summary: Research the ComputationPersistence reversal of TranHead decrement of ComputeCount

item.title: [ACOM-1812] Single screen for creating new Broker / Customer relationship combining CustomerMatch/MatchRule/BrokerCustomer
item.description:
Implement a new screen that will allow the user to enter all the CustomerMatch, MatchRule and BrokerCustomer data necessary to create a new Broker / Customer relationship on a single screen. When the user selects NEW from the CustomerMatch screen, this new screen should popup and allow entry of:

CustomerMatch data elements - DatEff, DatExp, MasterCustomer, LegalEntity, etc

Up to 5 MatchRules

Up to 5 BrokerCustomer records

When the user hits SAVE, the edits should be performed (including Entity Edits) and, if clean, the process should create the data into the CustomerMatch, MatchRule, and BrokerCustomer tables.
item.summary: Single screen for creating new Broker / Customer relationship combining CustomerMatch/MatchRule/BrokerCustomer

comments.comment: Note that this was requested by Excellus so it may be a billable change.

item.title: [ACOM-1761] Manager Portal view cut-off with small screens
item.description:
A user at a client site was having this issue in viewing the Manager portal.

The logout button and some other icons in upper right are cut-off in her view. She has the browser maximized. Also, it appears the 'Workflow' tab is cut off. She did not report this until after 4.9 was released. She never reported this issue with 4.8. There are screen shots attached. This was only in the Manager portal. I think the Manager portal may have the most tabs.

She has a pretty small screen and the highest resolution available is 1024 X 768.

Since then she has gotten a new computer screen from her IT department and she no longer has this issue. However, I think the issue still exists for anyone with that resolution.
item.environment:
Internet Explorer 7
https://arcadian.acteksoft.com/ACom3Arcadian/
Version 4.9.2.0-8
DB: ACTEK-prod4.ACom3Arcadian
client user - small screen. Largest resolution 1024 X 768
item.summary: Manager Portal view cut-off with small screens

comments.comment:
Eduardo,
The client worked around this issue by giving the user a better monitor so it is not a pressing issue. However, we should probably investigate if there is a way address. I wonder if it's possible to detect the viewport size and adjust accordingly? Anyway, this is a low priority issue that we should work on as we have an opportunity. Priority may be escalated if a client demands a solution.

Implemented tab panel scrolling.

Please let me know if the icons I selected are not acceptable. I tried several and didn't really like any of them. I was thinking of just creating my own with a simple white triangle, but decided to leave this as is and go on to more important (if less entertaining) issues.

This looks good. I'm not sure how easy it will be to correct, but the left arrow does not go away when you maximize the screen.
See http://screencast.com/t/DGqi8Fbyf
If it's too difficult to correct, we can ignore it. The key is that the user now has the ability to view all areas of the header regardless of their screen size.

Is the tab panel showing all the tabs when you do that? I.e., it may be that it is still scrolled when you maximized it (first tab hidden).

–
EK

I think I can fix it so that when the screen is resized to be large enough to contain all the tabs, the tabs will automatically scroll to the home position.

–
EK
I believe that will do the trick. Not all of my tabs are showing when maximized and the left arrow is still showing. It goes away when I use the left arrow until all tabs are showing.
Modified so that the tabs panel automatically scrolls to the home position when the screen is resized to be large enough to display all the tabs.

item.title: [ACOM-1728] Bonus - Query-based Bonus
item.description: Add a new Query-based Bonus Type that would be similar to the Query-based PerfType in that it should allow mapping of data elements from the query to the BrokerBonHis.
item.summary: Bonus - Query-based Bonus

item.title: [ACOM-1706] Entity Edits - implement ability to indicate Field as Required and turn field yellow
item.description:
When an Entity Edit is defined to require entry of a specific field, make the field yellow to indicate it is Required.

While making this change, may want to consider adding ability to designate other fields as "Conditionally Required". If a "tool tip" could be defined on the Entity Edit that would give the user an explanation of the "condition", that would be beneficial.
item.summary: Entity Edits - implement ability to indicate Field as Required and turn field yellow

comments.comment: Farley and I had a brief discussion about this and one idea was to all designation of the field(s) impacted by the edit and the desired color to assign to those fields. This would allow use of the "yellow" for required fields and a different color for "conditionally" required fields.

Kevin,

This is the issue I wrote up during our meeting with Michigan. Tom alluded to trying to have this done before Farley and I go to BCBSMI.

item.title: [ACOM-1701] Formulas - ability to indicate which Unit field and which Amount fields are utilized
item.description:
The Formulas are currently defined with hard-coded values allowed for Amounts and Units. That is, there is a specific list of Amount fields to use for Accumulation, a specific list of Amount fields to use as the Base, and only the SubsAct field is used for units. With new implementations, they are needing to use variations of Units on the transaction which means we have to record multiple Unit counts on a single transaction and have the Formula dictate which count is to be used for pricing.

Another issue has been created requesting addition of 10 more Unit and 10 more Amount fields on the transaction.
item.summary: Formulas - ability to indicate which Unit field and which Amount fields are utilized

item.title: [ACOM-1699] Broker Portal - implement data level security in remaining Broker Portal screens
item.description: Only Statement and Address screens have been modified to utilize the new Broker Portal Access security. The remaining Broker Portal screens need to be updated to include this security.
item.summary: Broker Portal - implement data level security in remaining Broker Portal screens

item.title: [ACOM-1697] Coventry - Payout processing times are getting excessively long
item.description:
The run times for Coventry's Production Payouts are taking a long time. They have not complained or raised it as an issue, but we need to research potential problem areas before they do raise it as an issue.

The attached spreadsheet highlights some specific runs where run times were 7+ hours.

The database ACom3Coventry48 on actek-dev11 has the production information. Bill Richardson can tell you what version this database is associated with.
item.summary: Coventry - Payout processing times are getting excessively long

comments.comment:
When running multi-threaded Repost is taking 4 hours. Of that approximately 30-45 min is the delete from RepostTranHis. The current query is as follows:
DELETE FROM RepostTranHis
WHERE
(PayoutTypeNo = 11886181680230000 AND
RunListNoPost NOT IN (SELECT RunListNo FROM RunList WHERE RecType = 'RPOTRN' AND RunListNoTaskParent = 12227879215420000)) OR TranHeadNo IN (SELECT TranHeadNo FROM TranHead WHERE RepostFlag = 'Y')

The "NOT IN" part is used so that Thread1 doesn't delete records associated with Thread2. This could be eliminated by executing in a ProcessListener (single threaded), which would simplify the query to:

DELETE FROM RepostTranHis
WHERE
PayoutTypeNo = 11886181680230000
OR TranHeadNo IN (SELECT TranHeadNo FROM TranHead WHERE RepostFlag = 'Y')

Additionally, according to the Estimated Execution Plan in SQL Server, using the following SQL Server specific join syntax would result is a 20x improvement
DELETE RPT
FROM RepostTranHis AS RPT
inner join TranHead AS TH on TH.RepostFlag = 'Y' AND RPT.TranHeadNo = TH.TranHeadNo

This table was originally truncated at the start of RepostTranHis. However due to PayoutTypes we have to execute deletes instead of Truncates in most situations. So the question remains, why don't we execute the delete/truncate during reversal like other processes.

item.title: [ACOM-1679] Email notifications to Statement Recipients when Payout has been Finalized and Statements are available for viewing online
item.description:
Currently, ACom3 can email, FTP, and/or copy Statements based on the Statement Delivery. However, one function that has come up in the last couple of demos (UHC, BCBSMI, American Family) that ACom3 can't do is email notifications when the Statements have been Finalized and are available online for viewing. The Statement doesn't need to be emailed.

Please enhance the Statement Delivery functionality to allow deliver of Email Notification (without the actual statement). This should provide the ability to define the Body of the email to be sent. This should also allow the Email Notification along with FTP or file copy. This Email Notification may indicate that the Statements are available online, or that the Statements have been delivered via FTP.
item.summary: Email notifications to Statement Recipients when Payout has been Finalized and Statements are available for viewing online

item.title: [ACOM-1611] Transaction Search - implement new InTranHead Search/Detail to display the InTranHead associated to the specific Transaction. Linkage should be by InTranHeadNo AND InpKey
item.description: As an improvement to the new Transaction Search functionality, it would be beneficial to be able to view the InTranHead records that were posted against the specific Transaction. This should be a new menu option under the Transaction Detail that locates the associated InTranHead based on the InTranHeadNo and the InpKey.
item.summary: Transaction Search - implement new InTranHead Search/Detail to display the InTranHead associated to the specific Transaction. Linkage should be by InTranHeadNo AND InpKey

comments.comment:
Kevin,

This is a new "child" inquiry to the Transaction Search functionality that was added in Release 4.9. So, every place that the new Transaction Search exists (Broker, Customer, Policy, etc.) should inherit this new function.

Below is a screen print from the Broker view. The InTranHead Search would go after Posting History or Transaction Messages

[cid:625430715@26092008-2817]

Dean,
Please provide more details on this issue regarding which menus/screens you want to update to include the related InTranHeads. Thanks.

Kevin Turner
ACTEK, Inc.<http://www.acteksoft.com/>
2120 Data Drive
Birmingham, AL 35244
Phone: (205) 443-6003
Mobile: (205) 903-0203
E-Mail: kturner@acteksoft.com<kturner@acteksoft.com>

item.title: [ACOM-1610] Implement InTranHead inquiry screens in Manager Portal under Customer, Policy, Broker menu structures
item.description: Implement Search/Detail screens that will allow inquiry into InTranHead from within the Manager Portal from within a specific Entity. For example, while researching a Customer within the Manager Portal, be able to search/view the InTranHead associated to that Customer. This would be beneficial under Broker, Customer, Policy.
item.summary: Implement InTranHead inquiry screens in Manager Portal under Customer, Policy, Broker menu structures

item.title: [ACOM-1575] Allow for multiple files per Import Request Type on File Sweep FTP setup
item.description: For Church Mutual we want to implement the file sweep feature to allow multiple customer and transaction files to be automatically uploaded into ACom3. We can not set up multiple files to create seperate infiles for the same import request type.
item.summary: Allow for multiple files per Import Request Type on File Sweep FTP setup

item.title: [ACOM-1494] Report Forms / Broker Portal - ability to run reports in "batch" and review the output later
item.description:
In the Broker Portal, implement the ability to run a report in "batch" and store the output for the User. This would be similar to the Report functionality recently removed but we would want to submit the reports from the new Prompt screen.
  • because some reports may always run a long time, we may need to set a flag on the Report Form to indicate that the report can only be generated in Batch.
  • for those Report Forms marked to allow online execution, make an option or parameter on the Prompt screen to allow generation in Batch.
  • be able to store PDF, Excel, CSV output in the report table
  • email the requestor a notification when the report is complete
item.summary: Report Forms / Broker Portal - ability to run reports in "batch" and review the output later

comments.comment: The ability to schedule and store reports is available in the Jasper Server product. I'm in the process of evaluating this to possibly license it so that it can be bundled with ACom3. This would provide ad-hoc reporting, user-configurable dashboards, etc.

item.title: [ACOM-1489] Row-Level Security
item.description: Enhance ACom3 Security to allow for row-level security by entity. The configuration should be related to the Security Group. This should automatically filter the data reported to the user based on the entity and their related security configuration.
item.summary: Row-Level Security

item.title: [ACOM-1482] Localization - Labels and Messages should vary based on User Locale.
item.description:
Make sure the Labels and Messages are used properly according to the User's Locale.

From APlan issue Coventry-Dev #53:
For the Coventry PartD and/or Commercial implementations, we will need to be able to vary the screen labels based on the user--some users will work specifically with Medicare while other users will work specifically with Commercial.
item.summary: Localization - Labels and Messages should vary based on User Locale.

comments.comment: See also APlan issue Coventry-Dev #53.

Comment copied from the APlan issue:

Johnny, I think this may be as simple as adding the Locale selection to the User entity and then storing on the session. The Label tag could then pull this from the session and filter. Some thought should be put into defaulting and conversion. Please research/design. Let me know if you want to discuss. This is targeted for Dev (not 4.3).

See also ACOM-414
This will also need to be available for the MMM and Triple S implementations to default the labels by User locale and consider a primary locale default and if label not specified for a locale, default the standard label.

item.title: [ACOM-1481] Wizards for creating Brokers, BrokerCustomers, BrokerDetails.
item.description:
Design and develop wizards that will make it easy to create new Brokers, Broker Customers, and Broker Details.

See also APlan issues Coventry-Dev 338, 339 and 340.
item.summary: Wizards for creating Brokers, BrokerCustomers, BrokerDetails.

comments.comment: See attached file for Dean's notes on each of the wizards.

item.title: [ACOM-1475] Security - ability enter NEW data but not MODIFY existing da
item.description: Ability to enter NEW data but not MODIFY existing data. This would be useful when bringing in additional help at peak times to get data entered (such as adding hundreds or thousands of new brokers). User should have authority to add new data and modify the records if he/she is the user that entered the record (in case they mess something up) but not update any records where he/she is not the ?First User? and ?Last User?.
item.summary: Security - ability enter NEW data but not MODIFY existing da

item.title: [ACOM-1474] Deleting Broker - delete all "config" data
item.description: Currently, to delete a Broker, the user must first delete all the Broker related configuration data. It would be useful to have a function that will allow the user to delete the Broker and indicate that all related configuration data should be automatically deleted. The configuration data would include: Addresses, Vendor (if created from the Broker) and associated Addresses), BrokerDetail, BrokerCustomer, BrokerHold, BrokerLicense, ProLicense, ProAppointment, ProInsurance, ProContract, ProBackground, Producer (if created from the Broker or ProducerId matches BrokerId), etc.
item.summary: Deleting Broker - delete all "config" data

comments.comment:
Also consider:

Once a month Coventry does cleanup (50 - 100 brokers) of unused/unnecessary Brokers. Need to come up with a method to delete brokers in batch so that the user isn?t locked up while the referential checking is going on. This could be as simple as designing a new process where the user enters the list of BrokerIds to delete and running the process. The more secure and robust design would be to allow the user to "mark" the Broker for Delete and have a batch process sweep the Broker table and process each Broker marked for delete. This would allow multiple users to be mark Brokers during the month and then one execution of the process would process all of them. For those Brokers that aren't deleted because of referential data, a NOTE could be created and attached to the Broker indicating the Delete could not take place.

item.title: [ACOM-1460] Reserves - Add updated functionality
item.description: Design - Functionality additions for reserves
item.summary: Reserves - Add updated functionality

comments.comment:
Kevin,

We need to start pursuing the Reserve designs since we have both TripleS and MMM requiring functionality that we currently don't support. We have the prototype for MMM next week and will be steering around the reserves as a development issue that will be in place prior to them going live. MMM's production date target is before their open enrollment which is November. When can we get a target date defined on the Reserves enhancements so we can move toward a delivery?

I am including some notes from a brief discussion Farley and I had today. The items in bold are based on current requirements from either MMM or Triple S. The non-bold items are "like to have" enhancement pieces.

Reserves

Inputs
  • Match Rules for transactions
    • All transaction types/data
    • Adjustments can be +/- impact and be applied to the whole or subset balance
  • Match Rules for Brokers
    • Allow inclusion/exclusion of Brokers
Ability to review/release reserve by transaction using Search and Select individually/all
Generate versus Assign
Reserve Chargebacks
  • Global
    • Max transaction amount
    • Max amount of reserve pool %
    • Minimum amount (floor)
    • Transaction Source Only
Reserve Grouping
  • Allow for a group/collection of Brokers or Vendors
Processing/Parameters
  • Auto release at defined intervals
    • After X periods per transactions that qualify
  • Liquidation of reserve balances
    • After X periods/months
    • Floor
      • X amount minimum after liquidation
      • X % of reserve balance as new floor
      • Allow at transaction level to release
  • Ceiling
    • Transaction max amount
    • Reserve total max amount
Track reserve balance across all products or individually by product

Thanks.

Paige Franks
[cid:image003.jpg@01C90549.66323E10]
ACTEK, Incorporated
2120 Data Office Drive
Birmingham, Alabama 35244
Phone: 205-443-6028
Fax: 205-403-0120
Email: pfranks@acteksoft.com<pfranks@acteksoft.com>
Cell: 205-383-9997
URL: http://www.acteksoft.com/<blocked::http://www.acteksoft.com/>

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: The materials in this electronic mail transmission (including all attachments) are private and confidential and are the property of the sender. The information contained in the material is privileged and is intended only for the use of the named addressee(s). If you are not the intended addressee, be advised that any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution or the taking of any action in reliance on the contents of this material is strictly prohibited. If you received this electronic mail message in error, please notify the sender immediately by replying to this message and informing the sender of the problem and thereafter, destroy the electronic message immediately.
When this is designed, the current use of Reserves for MCS and UCCI need to be taken into account. Additionally, MCS has provided some additional Reserve requirements.

After discussion (FL, DP, PF, JC, KT), it was determined that the MMM requirements for deferred payments would better fit the PayoutSet functionality rather than Reserves. This was determined because transactions should be deferred and chargebacks for other transactions should not impact the deferred payments for the original transaction. The Reserves feature has the concept of pooled money to be held and applied to chargebacks. There is no concept of isolating amounts by transaction.

This issue will be placed on a lower priority and will be addressed in a later release. A new issue will be added to address the changes required for the PayoutSet feature. This currently does not properly handle retroactivity scenarios. Changes will be made to the PayoutSet feature to support retroactivity and to fill any other gaps needed for MMM's deferred payment requirements.

Based on our discussions, I have updated the Reserves issue to a lower priority. I added a new one (ACOM-1514<http://jira.acteksoft.com:8080/browse/ACOM-1514>) to track the deferred payment requirements for MMM. This has a critical priority. I set the due date to 9/12 because that is about as reasonable as I can get on a delivery.

From: Paige Franks
Sent: Friday, August 29, 2008 9:12 AM
To: Kevin Turner
Cc: Dean Patterson; Johnny Clark; Farley Lavett
Subject: RE: ACOM-1460

Since the 10:00 a.m. conf call today with MMM was cancelled, will that work for everyone?

From: Kevin Turner
Sent: Friday, August 29, 2008 8:53 AM
To: Farley Lavett
Cc: Dean Patterson; Paige Franks; Johnny Clark
Subject: RE: ACOM-1460

While we've made progress this week on the Broker Portal issues, there's still much to do. It may be good for us to meet today on this to discuss the requirements. Once the requirements are understood, Johnny and I can discuss design solutions and he would take the lead on the design. This will allow me to continue to work with the team on the Coventry Broker Portal issues. Please propose a time that works for you guys. My schedule is open.

From: Farley Lavett
Sent: Monday, August 25, 2008 8:44 AM
To: Kevin Turner
Cc: Dean Patterson; Paige Franks
Subject: RE: ACOM-1460

Put it late in this week to follow your closure on the other design so that you are not further delayed in getting that one completed and able to hand it off for development - that would be fine.

From: Kevin Turner
Sent: Monday, August 25, 2008 8:28 AM
To: Paige Franks
Cc: Dean Patterson; Farley Lavett
Subject: RE: ACOM-1460

It will be probably be late this week before I can begin on the Reserves. There's still much to do on the Broker Portal security for Coventry. We could get together before then to discuss the requirements and plan for a delivery.

From: Paige Franks
Sent: Saturday, August 23, 2008 5:55 PM
To: Kevin Turner
Cc: Dean Patterson; Farley Lavett; JIRA
Subject: ACOM-1460

Kevin,

We need to start pursuing the Reserve designs since we have both TripleS and MMM requiring functionality that we currently don't support. We have the prototype for MMM next week and will be steering around the reserves as a development issue that will be in place prior to them going live. MMM's production date target is before their open enrollment which is November. When can we get a target date defined on the Reserves enhancements so we can move toward a delivery?

I am including some notes from a brief discussion Farley and I had today. The items in bold are based on current requirements from either MMM or Triple S. The non-bold items are "like to have" enhancement pieces.

Reserves

(1) Inputs

  • Match Rules for transactions

o All transaction types/data

o Adjustments can be +/- impact and be applied to the whole or subset balance

  • Match Rules for Brokers

o Allow inclusion/exclusion of Brokers

(2) Ability to review/release reserve by transaction using Search and Select individually/all

(3) Generate versus Assign

(4) Reserve Chargebacks

  • Global

o Max transaction amount

o Max amount of reserve pool %

o Minimum amount (floor)

  • Transaction Source Only

(5) Reserve Grouping

  • Allow for a group/collection of Brokers or Vendors

(6) Processing/Parameters

(a) Auto release at defined intervals

  • After X periods per transactions that qualify

(b) Liquidation of reserve balances

  • After X periods/months
  • Floor

o X amount minimum after liquidation

o X % of reserve balance as new floor

o Allow at transaction level to release

(c) Ceiling

  • Transaction max amount
  • Reserve total max amount

(7) Track reserve balance across all products or individually by product

Thanks.

Paige Franks

item.title: [ACOM-1454] Statement Types - Jasper Reports/Statement integration
item.description: Design/develop feature that would integrate Jasper Report templates to be used for generation of the Statement content. This should allow upload of Jasper Report template and configuration to assign the template based on Vendor and/or PayoutType. It should also be configurable based on normal vs. Bonus Payout runs.
item.summary: Statement Types - Jasper Reports/Statement integration

item.title: [ACOM-1328] Transaction Inquiry - ERROR transaction handling
item.description:
Enhance the Transaction Inquiry (TranHead inquiry) to provide the following functionality once APlan ACom3Dev #790 and #1372 are done:

Provide a constraint to select TranHead marked in ERROR and, if available, a constraint for the date on which the transactions were marked in ERROR. This would allow the user to search all TranHead marked in ERROR during Payout on a specific date.

Provide ability from the Transaction Detail (TranHead) screen to "close" the ERROR to indicate that it had been researched and is a valid ERROR and no further action is required. For example, BrokerCustomer not found because the customer terminated could be a valid ERROR and does not need any further action. This will need a corresponding "undo" action in case the ERROR is closed incorrectly. Need to record the user marking the transaction as "closed" or undo'ing the close action.

Provide the ability to attach Notes to the transaction to allow the user to record the corrections made to fix the Error and mark the Transaction for Reposting.

Provide the ability to mark the Transaction for Reposting. Need to record the user marking the transaction for reposting.

Provide the ability to unmark the Transaction for Reposting. Need to record the user unmarking the transaction for reposting.
item.summary: Transaction Inquiry - ERROR transaction handling

item.title: [ACOM-1327] TranHead - mark as ERROR when problems Reposting/Computing
item.description:
In an effort to build better tools for users and support personnel to research problems, we need to be able to identify Transactions (TranHead) that encountered some type of error during the last attempt to Repost/Compute.

Adding an indicator to TranHead to signify when an Error is encountered when the transaction is Reposted/Computed will allow us to build online inquiries, extracts, etc.

When the TranHead is successfully Reposted/Computed (processed with no Errors), this indicator should be turned off.

This new indicator should provide the following (see APlan ACom3Dev #1373):
Not in Error Status
In Error Status
Errors Closed
item.summary: TranHead - mark as ERROR when problems Reposting/Computing

item.title: [ACOM-1237] Implement PolicyPrepay EarnedEarly/EarnedLatePolicy
item.description:
We need to implement the PolicyPrepay the logic for the EarnedEarlyPolicy and EarnedLatePolicy fields.
See the design for ACom3Dev #1119.
item.summary: Implement PolicyPrepay EarnedEarly/EarnedLatePolicy

comments.comment:
According to design, following are possible values for EarnedLatePolicy:
Pay As Earned - This has been implemented (this was and is the default logic)
Apply Immediately - This has been implemented as part of changes for ACOM-1554
Defer Until True-Up - Not implemented.

EarnedeARLYPolicy:
Pay Immediately - This has been implemented (this was and is the default logic)
Defer Until True-Up - Not implemented.

The "Defer Until True-Up" option requires implementing the True-Up process. We don't have a design for it. Let me know if you want me to implement it by modeling it after CoventryTrueUpTask.

item.title: [ACOM-1014] Modeling/Forecasting Support
item.description: Add product support for forecasting and modeling.
item.summary: Modeling/Forecasting Support

item.title: [ACOM-1008] Bonus Enhancements
item.description: Several ideas have been proposed to improve upon the ACom3 Bonus design. The purpose of this issue is to clean up the existing Bonus functionality and to add powerful new features.
item.summary: Bonus Enhancements

comments.comment:
Please also consider these items in the redesign of the bonus:
1) Add Generate Zero Bonus option - ability to generate a 0 brokerbonhis/brokerhistory
2) Add TransRef fields to BrokerBonHis and provide a means for those fields and the Match fields to be defaulted and persisted to Brokerhistory.
